getDay
Returns the date of the month in local time from the specified date.
Syntax
getDay
(date)
Setting
Purpose
date
Date, the number of the month that must be calculated.
The date can be specified as an attribute, a variable (in the algorithm), a calculated indicator or an algorithm.
Note
The function is called using the
button, located in the Algorithm Editor on the "Date" tab.
As a parameter of the function, specify the date from which the number (day of the month) will be calculated.
Example
The following line of the algorithm code is used to automatically calculate the date of completing the reporting form:
This algorithm should return the date - the first day of the month of the reporting form (not the current date).
The GetDay function calculates a number from the current date. Then, one is subtracted from that number to get the number of days that have passed since the beginning of the month.
Using the
plusDays
function, a negative value is added to the current date by multiplying by (-1), thus the algorithm returns the first day of the month.
